ABOLISHED.Definition: formally put an end to (a system, practice, or institution).

‍SPOILS.Definition: goods stolen or taken forcibly from a person or place, treasure

INITIATIVES.Definition: an act or strategy intended to resolve a difficulty or improve a situation; a fresh approach to something.

‍BIDDER.Definition: a person or organization making a formal offer for something, especially at an auction.

‍SHARE OWNERSHIP.Definition: the concept that something can be owned by multiple different people

‍SCHEMES.Definition: a secret or underhanded plan; a plot.

‍SCHEMING.Definition: make plans, especially in a devious way or with intent to do something illegal or wrong.

LOOPHOLES.Definition: an ambiguity or inadequacy in the law or a set of rules.

‍ENTERPRISING.Definition: having or showing initiative and resourcefulness.

‍SUBSIDIES.Definition: a sum of money granted by the state or a public body to help an industry or business keep the price of a commodity or service low.

‍SPECULATE.Definition: invest in stocks, property, or other ventures in the hope of gain but with the risk of loss.

CURRENCY MARKETS.Definition: the markets where people buy and sell different currencies (different types of money)

ARBITRAGING.Definition: the simultaneous buying and selling of securities, currency, or commodities in different markets or in derivative forms in order to take advantage of differing prices for the same asset.

‍STOOD.Definition: to go towards or be destined for

‍FREE REIN.Definition: the freedom to do what they want

‍TENDERS.Definition: seek offers to carry out work at a stated fixed price

‍MARKET ECONOMY.Definition: an economy driven by markets, as exists in a capitalist system. Opposite of a centrally-planned economy

‍LOOT.Definition: money, used here to convey that the money wasn't got legally. Usually used for criminal activity

SCANDALOUS.Definition: causing general public outrage by a perceived offence against morality or law.

AUCTIONING OFF.Definition: to sell off to the person who says they will pay the most money

‍AUCTIONEER.Definition: the person or company who is in charge of an auction

‍ALONG CAME.Definition: Arrived, used here to emphasis dramatic entry

‍PURGED.Definition: remove (a group of people considered undesirable) from an organization or place in an abrupt or violent way.

UNCORROBORATED.Definition: not confirmed or supported by other evidence or information

‍CHUNK.Definition: A large amount or percentage of
